title: Identify the Anode and Cathode
text: In a galvanic cell, the anode is where oxidation occurs, and the cathode is where reduction occurs. Look at the image to identify which is the anode and which is the cathode.

title: Oxidation Reaction at the Anode
text: At the anode, zinc (Zn) is oxidized. Write the half-reaction for the oxidation of zinc.

title: Oxidation Half-Reaction
text: Write the oxidation half-reaction for zinc at the anode.

title: Reduction Reaction at the Cathode
text: At the cathode, hydrogen ions (H+) are reduced. Write the half-reaction for the reduction of hydrogen ions.

title: Reduction Half-Reaction
text: Write the reduction half-reaction for hydrogen ions at the cathode.

title: Combine the Half-Reactions
text: Combine the oxidation and reduction half-reactions to write the overall cell reaction.

title: Overall Cell Reaction
text: Combine the half-reactions to write the overall cell reaction.
